keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP want to implement an Australian-style points-based immigration system.
UKIP believes in a National Health Service free at the point of use.
The out of touch Westminster elite do not understand what the people want. We need to reform the cosy Westminster club.

Julian welcomes UKIP transport commitments such as scrapping HS2 and spending the saved money on local projects, fixing the potholes on existing roads and local transport issues like a park and ride for Batheaston and Batheast Oldfield Park traffic systems. He is also against the idea of a congestion charge for Bath.

issues.economy: BUILDING A BETTER FUTURE Julian believes in driving choice back into our secondary education system for Maths, Science, Learning and Technology and Apprenticeships.
issues.education: BUILDING A BETTER FUTURE Julian believes in driving choice back into our secondary education system for Maths, Science, Learning and Technology and Apprenticeships.
issues.governance: Political reform: The out of touch Westminster elite do not understand what the people want. We need to reform the cosy Westminster club.
issues.health: Safeguard the NHS: UKIP believes in a National Health Service free at the point of use.
issues.immigration: Control our borders: UKIP want to implement an Australian-style points-based immigration system.

housing.content: TRANSPORT Julian welcomes UKIP transport commitments such as scrapping HS2 and spending the saved money on local projects, fixing the potholes on existing roads and local transport issues like a park and ride for Batheaston and Batheast Oldfield Park traffic systems. He is also against the idea of a congestion charge for Bath.

endorsements.endorsement: Nigel Farage addressed Bath’s street stall declaring his support for local candidate Julian.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Provided by Julian Deverell's campaign office at Queen of Hearts, 96 Mount Road, Bath, BA2 1LN. Registered through Print Ninja Ltd.
